title: Emergency bushfire warnings in Western Australia
description: A bushfire emergency warning has been issued for areas north of Perth.  A watch and act alert has also been issued for areas between Bowes and Howatharra.  The temperatures are predicted to reach up to 39 degrees Celsius over the weekend, impacting the region significantly.

title: King Charles to reduce cancer treatment
description: King Charles has publicly discussed his prostate cancer recovery, announcing a reduction in treatment due to early diagnosis and effective care.   He emphasised the importance of early cancer checks and is using his experience to support the Stand Up To Cancer campaign, encouraging others to share their stories.  His openness signifies a shift towards transparency in the royal family, offering empathy and encouragement to millions facing cancer.

title: ‘Record high’ government spending: Treasurer takes $12.4bn spending hit in budget
description: Former Queensland premier Campbell Newman claims the “record-high” government spending is causing “inflationary pressures,” after it’s been revealed Treasurer Jim Chalmers has taken a $12.4 billion spending hit in the budget.  “We are putting pressure on the economy, which is requiring higher interest rates,” Mr Newman told Sky News host Steve Price.  “Next year, we will probably see them [interest rates] go up.”

title: ‘We don’t want to waste time’: US refuses to attend unproductive Ukraine meetings
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will meet European leaders to discuss potential resolutions to the conflict with Russia, with a focus on territorial concessions.   He emphasises the need for military success to bolster diplomatic efforts while stressing that any decisions regarding ceding land will require a national referendum.   As pressure mounts for a peace deal, Zelenskyy seeks security guarantees from the US and Europe to prevent a future Russian invasion.  The US has not committed to attending the meeting in Paris.   When asked the reason for this, US President Donald Trump has said, “We don’t want to waste a lot of time.”

title: ‘Go home’: More than 2.5 million illegal immigrants have fled the US
description: El Salvador national Kilmar Armando Ábrego García has been released from US immigration custody after a judge ruled his detention unlawful.  The case gained media attention following his deportation to a prison in El Salvador and ongoing attempts by officials to deport him.   The White House intends to appeal the ruling as Democratic lawmakers criticise current immigration practices amid rising deportation numbers.  During questioning, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said, “Every person that’s in this country illegally has an opportunity to voluntarily go home.”  Since President Trump returned to office, more than 2.5 million illegal immigrants have left the US, including more than 605,000 deportations.

title: Bird flu is rapidly spreading in Madrid
description: Spanish authorities confirmed four outbreaks of bird flu in wild birds in central Madrid.  Over 100 storks have been found dead within a 24-hour period.  In response, officials are enhancing biosecurity measures to prevent further spread.  No commercial poultry farms have been affected, and risks to humans remain low.

title: Trump's new Gold Card Visa: One-million-dollar US citizenship fast-track
description: Political Commentator Stephanie Hamill supports Trump's launch of the ‘Gold Card’ visa.   “The question is, is this going to benefit Americans who are already here?” Ms Hamill told Sky News host Rowan Dean.  “These are high-value immigrants who want to contribute to this country, who will also create jobs if they're coming here to create business.  “This just strengthens the program that was already in place.”

title: 'He should be embarrassed’: David Letterman crowns Jimmy Kimmel the resistance leader
description: Political Commentator Stephanie Hamill slams Jimmy Kimmel's recent segment with David Letterman.  “That segment was incredibly painful,” Ms Hamill told Sky News host Rowan Dean.  “It makes me wonder what happened to comedy.  “For Letterman to crown him with the resistance crown, that’s not really a great reward.  “He should actually be embarrassed for himself."

title: Citizens sabotage migrants trying to cross the English Channel
description: Sky News contributor Adrian Hayes supports British far-right activists travelling across the Channel to northern France to confront migrants and destroy small boats.  “I think it’s a bigger picture than this … when there’s a shambolic operation, to try and stop it, citizens will step in,” Mr Hayes told Sky News host Steve Price.  “These are ex-military veterans largely.   “The footage is astonishing. They’ve really proved that if there was a will, there’s courage, and there’s a way you could stop these boats.  “They’re showing that the French police are just completely aiding this illegal operation.”

title: ‘They’re frightened’: Nigel Farage targeted for having a real chance at Prime Minister
description: Sky News contributor Adrian Hayes thinks allegations that the Reform leader Nigel Farage made racist and antisemitic remarks as a student show he is being targeted.  “There’s a campaign led by that bastion of great journalism, The Guardian,” Mr Hayes told Sky News host Steve Price.  “They’re frightened.  “What we said and what we did 50 years ago is far different from today's world.”

title: Search for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer intensifies after her phone resurfaces
description: A mobile phone belonging to missing tourist Celine Cremer has been found after two and a half years.   The phone will undergo forensic examination by the police.  Ms Cremer vanished in Tasmania in June 2023.  Friends from Belgium are assisting in the search led by private detective Ken Gamble.

title: ‘Violates democratic principle’: Indigenous Treaty enacted despite majority no votes
description: Former Labour MP Michael Danby slams Premier Jacinta Allan for her apology to Indigenous Victorians in parliament as part of the state's historic treaty agreement that was signed into law last month.  “60 per cent of Victorians voted against it, so that violates one democratic principle,” Mr Danby told Sky News host Rowan Dean.  “Only 7 per cent of the 70 to 80 thousand indigenous people voted for the group who are going to benefit from this Treaty.  “There doesn’t seem to be much interest or involvement by the people who are affected.”

title: ‘Kiss of death’: Meghan and Harry publicly support Australia’s social media ban
description: Sky News host Rowan Dean pokes fun at Prince Harry and Meghan Markle backing Australia’s under-16 social media ban.  “Could it be the kiss of death,” Mr Dean said.  “I would have thought that would be the last thing you want to hear.”

title: Thailand-Cambodia conflict rages on despite ceasefire
description: Cambodia has released videos of two bridges damaged by a naval strike as tensions rise with Thailand.  Thailand’s Prime Minister has pledged ongoing military action.   The conflict reignited following a failed ceasefire brokered by former President Trump, with current developments indicating continued hostilities despite claims of a ceasefire.   The situation remains volatile as both nations prepare for further military engagement.

title: Russia launches strikes at three Ukrainian ships
description: Ukraine's Navy reported a missile strike by Russia in the Odessa region.  The strike hit three Turkish-owned vessels.   Emergency crews are working to extinguish a burning ship.  Russia also attacked Odessa's energy infrastructure a few hours beforehand.
